Uses of Class
Entity

  • Uses of Entity in <Unnamed>

    Subclasses of Entity in <Unnamed> 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Enemy
    Represents an enemy which can be fought by the player Enemies hold a random item that will be given to the player if the player defeats it This enemy has no magical attacks and has a base damage of 5.
    class  EnemyDecorator
    Decorator class to add functionality to an Enemy Allows decorators to change the name and maximum HP of the enemy
    class  Froglok
    Represents an enemy called Froglok
    class  Goblin
    Represents an enemy called Goblin
    class  Hero
    Represents the player which has the ability to move around the map and attack enemies with physical and magical attacks.
    class  Orc
    Represents an enemy called Orc
    class  Troll
    Represents an enemy called Troll
    class  Warlock
    Used to decorate an Enemy, increasing its max HP by 1 and giving it magical attacks Performs an additional attack after normal attack that is magical
    class  Warrior
    Used to decorate an Enemy, increasing its max HP by 2 and giving it an additional attack
    Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Entity 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String Enemy.attack​(Entity e)
    Deals damage to entity passed as parameter There is a random number from 0 to 3 added to the amount of damage dealt damage = 5 + rand(0, 3) where rand(0, 3) is a random number from 0 to 3, inclusive
    abstract java.lang.String Entity.attack​(Entity e)
    Used to deal a certain amount of damage to another entity and describes the type of damage
    java.lang.String Hero.attack​(Entity e)
    Physical attack to deal damage to entity passed as parameter There is a random number from 0 to 3 added to the amount of damage dealt damage = 3 + rand(0, 3) where rand(0, 3) is a random number from 0 to 3, inclusive
    java.lang.String Warlock.attack​(Entity e)
    Attacks the entity using the super's attack method then picks a random magic attack to use on the entity
    java.lang.String Warrior.attack​(Entity e)
    Calls the super's attack method twice and returns the output
    java.lang.String Hero.fireball​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Fireball that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 3 and 6, inclusive
    java.lang.String Magical.fireball​(Entity e)
    Used to attack an entity with the Magical attack "Fireball"
    java.lang.String Warlock.fireball​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Fireball that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 5 and 8, inclusive
    java.lang.String Hero.magicMissile​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Magic Missile that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 3 and 6, inclusive
    java.lang.String Magical.magicMissile​(Entity e)
    Used to attack an entity with the Magical attack "Magic Missile"
    java.lang.String Warlock.magicMissile​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Magic Missile that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 5 and 8, inclusive
    java.lang.String Hero.thunderClap​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Thunderclap that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 3 and 6, inclusive
    java.lang.String Magical.thunderClap​(Entity e)
    Used to attack an entity with the Magical attack "Thunderclap"
    java.lang.String Warlock.thunderClap​(Entity e)
    Magical attack type called Thunderclap that has deals to an entity a random amount of damage between 5 and 8, inclusive
